statement: Given an array a, let f(x) be the number of occurrences of x in the array a. For example, when a=[1,2,3,1,4], then f(1)=2 and f(3)=1. You have an array b of size n. Please determine if there is an array a of size n such that f(a_i)=b_i for all 1 â‰¤q i â‰¤q n. If there is one, construct it.
input_specification: InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases t (1 â‰¤ t â‰¤ 10^4). The description of the test cases follows. The first line of each test case contains an integer n (1 â‰¤q n â‰¤q 2Â· 10^5).The second line contains n integers b_1,b_2,...,b_n (1 â‰¤q b_i â‰¤q n).It is guaranteed that the sum of n over all test cases does not exceed 2Â· 10^5.
output_specification: OutputFor each test case, output -1 if there is no valid array a.Otherwise, print the array a of n integers on a new line. The elements should satisfy 1 â‰¤q a_i â‰¤q n.
note:
In the first test case, it can be shown that no array matches the requirement.
In the second test case,
4
,

,

appear
1,2,3
times respectively. Thus, the output array is correct as
ğ‘“(4),ğ‘“(5),ğ‘“(5),ğ‘“(6),ğ‘“(6),ğ‘“(6)
